page.title: 06Living at Chatsworth
page.content: For the people who live at{Chatsworth} the year is sharply divided between the seven months when the House and gardens are open and the five winter months when both are closed. About a quarter of a million people see round it from March to October. During that time the staff are busy with the routine work which such a big house and so many visitors require. There is also the day to day maintenance of the fabric of the building, inside and out. In winter the big cleaning takes place and any restoration necessary in the public rooms. In spite of its vast size the house has a wonderful atmosphere and is very much a house, both to us and to the six other families who have appartments there. The beauty of the house, its situation and the things in it are a continual joy which none of us take for granted.
